revised_title: A Historical Overview of the Royal Society's Statutes and Publication Practices
tldr: This article provides a detailed historical analysis of the changes and developments in the Royal Society's statutes and publication practices from 1663 to 1752. It highlights the modifications made to the election and admission of fellows, the role of the council, and the publication of the Philosophical Transactions. The article sheds light on the evolution of the society's governance and scientific communication over time.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
